title: SoC MTS 525-0-23 Special Topics Research Seminar
class_attributes:
Attendance at 1st class mandatory

Graduate Students Only

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
Big data is currency, to those initiated in the nuts and bolts of data science. This graduate lab introduces cutting edge research on networks, crowds and cultural markets, and provides you with algorithmic and programming tools to apply this research. You will learn about a selection of techniques for exploratory visualization, modelling, simulation, text mining and machine learning. The studied methods are useful across a variety of fields in which aggregate behavior and network effects play a crucial role.
Prerequisite for the class is a level of comfort with basic mathematical definitions and the statistical software R. Taking Noshir Contractor's "Social Network Analysis" class beforehand is highly encouraged.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Students must bring either a laptop or tablet with internet access.

subject: MTS
